data.title: ArchiveGrid : Papers : of the Keith family of Woodburn, Fauquier County, Va.,. 1710
meta_keywords: find search library libraries archive archives collection catalog genealogy history author title digital document photo
data.meta_description: ArchiveGrid connects you with archives around the world to find historical documents, personal papers, family histories, and more.
data.text:
Details

193 items

The collection includes letters, 1772-1777, written by John Chilton (1739-1777) of Fauquier County, Va., primarily while serving with the 3rd Virginia Infantry Regiment of the U.S. Continental Army in New Jersey; account book, 1816-1840, kept by Joseph Chilton (1774-1841) in Fauquier County, Va., concerning mercantile, flour milling, and plantation operations; and land and estate records of Thomas Keith (d. 1805) of Fauquier County, Va

Also, includes correspondence, 1842-1862, of Isham Keith (1801- 1863) of "Woodburn," Fauquier County, Va., and as president of the Fauquier White Sulphur Springs Company, a health resort; account book, 1837-1838, concerning flour milling in Fauquier County; accounts; land records; and miscellany. Also, includes correspondence, 1839-1844, of Jones Green (concerning musicians for an orchestra), Thomas Green, Robert Eden Lee, William McNish, and Daniel Ward as presidents of or agents for the Fauquier White Sulphur Springs Company

In the collections of the Virginia Historical Society, Richmond, Va. (Mss1/K2694/a)

Keith family (of Wooburn, Fauquier County, Va.) papers (Mss1K2694b-c), Virginia Historical Society

Unpublished description available
